intro: Inga subnuda subsp. lushnathiana, commonly known as the Lushnath's inga, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to parts of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. It has a shallow root system and is often used in agroforestry systems due to its nitrogen-fixing ability. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other Inga species.
